hey everyone! today we woke up early and were on the road at 7:00 to go to yellowstone. we drove for a long time today. we got all the way down to old faithful and it just pained me to not go to my grandparents ranch which is like 2 hours away. we had so much fun today! sarah and i sang a lot on the way there, which people either enjoyed or hated. oh well. we saw bison, elk, birds, and a little black blob which everyone said was a baby black bear (i didn't have my glasses on). we stopped at mcdonalds on the way back and got here at about 9:00pm. i showered and we are going to finish the movie we rented last night (gothica). tomorrow some people (including me!) are going to hike up a mountain which is close to here. it should be great! hope all is well to who ever reads this

Today was wonderful and so much fun. It was the first time I was in Wyoming and the first time I peed in the woods this trip. It was a blast with everyone and seeing old faithful. There were beautiful mountains and animals. Also with Mcdonalds and ice cream it doesnt get much better. Tomorrow we are climbing a mountain. No blisters today so hopefully I wont get them. Hope everything is well in SC.

hi everyone, we made it! we are having tons of fun. tonight for dinner we had steak and chicken. it was 80 degrees today and we got to go on a nice walk. tomorrow we will focus on packing for camping and thursday we will visit yellowstone. everyone is so nice and we are having a great time. check out Sarah Tolan's bio for an audio blog from both of us. miss ya'll!
Well we all made it to Montana and we're safe so you don't have to worry. Pretty nice here, it rained a little but other than that the weather has been great.

Well as usual Rachel is going nuts. She's trying to get the ferret to respond to her high pitch screams. Yeah.... Anyway people seem to actually want to do this blogging thing so I guess you'll be seeing a lot of the posts around the biographies. It's all good. I'll be sending more later.

Well all is well here in Montana. We just had a thunderstorm run through, but we didn't get all that much rain. As you've probably heard, this morning I got sick on the airplane. It's really beautiful out here, and now I'm just trying to get used to the time change. We had dinner at what would have been my 900. It was really weird and now we're all dead tired from the long day. I don't know what we're doing tomorrow, but I guess we'll find out soon!! ttyl.

After eleven straight days in the woods, we have finally emerged for the most part unscathed. Desperate craving pizza, we have elected to find the nearest joint in Bozeman. Throughout this long trek many things have come to pass. In the woods we have sampled squirrel, snake and trout. We have gone without showers, some elected to use the 5 degree waterfall, but the rest of us held out. More stories will be posted as time goes on but the most important thing is that all the research got done and our trip was a major success. We would like to thank everybody that made this possible including our corporate sponsor, Accuweather.
